Package org.jlab.coda.jevio

Class EvioReaderUnsyncV6

java.lang.Object
org.jlab.coda.jevio.EvioReaderUnsyncV6
All Implemented Interfaces:
IEvioReader
Direct Known Subclasses:
EvioReaderV6
public class EvioReaderUnsyncV6 extends Object implements IEvioReader
This class is used to read an evio version 6 format file or buffer. It is called by an EvioReader object. This class is mostly a wrapper to the new hipo library.

The streaming effect of parsing an event is that the parser will read the event and hand off structures, such as banks, to any IEvioListeners. For those familiar with XML, the event is processed SAX-like. It is up to the listener to decide what to do with the structures.

As an alternative to stream processing, after an event is parsed, the user can use the events treeModel for access to the structures. For those familiar with XML, the event is processed DOM-like.

This class is a NOT thread safe version of EvioReaderV6, but presumably faster.

Although this class can be used directly, it's generally used by using EvioCompactReader which, in turn, uses this class.

Since:
version 6
Author:
timmer

    • EvioReaderUnsyncV6

      public EvioReaderUnsyncV6(String path, boolean checkRecNumSeq) throws EvioException, IOException
      Constructor for reading an event file.
      Parameters:
      path - the full path to the file that contains events. For writing event files, use an EventWriter object.
      checkRecNumSeq - if true check the record number sequence and throw an exception if it is not sequential starting with 1
      Throws:
      IOException - if read failure
      EvioException - if file arg is null; if first record number != 1 when checkRecNumSeq arg is true
      See Also:
      • EventWriter

    • EvioReaderUnsyncV6

      public EvioReaderUnsyncV6(ByteBuffer byteBuffer, boolean checkRecNumSeq) throws EvioException
      Constructor for reading a buffer.
      Parameters:
      byteBuffer - the buffer that contains events.
      checkRecNumSeq - if true check the record number sequence and throw an exception if it is not sequential starting with 1
      Throws:
      EvioException - if buf is null; if first record number != 1 when checkRecNumSeq arg is true; if buffer too small, not in the proper format, or earlier than version 6.
      See Also:
      • EventWriter

      public void setBuffer(ByteBuffer buf) throws EvioException, IOException
      This method can be used to avoid creating additional EvioReader objects by reusing this one with another buffer. The method close() is called before anything else.

      public EvioEvent getFirstEvent()
      Get the "first" event if there is one. It's also called the Beginning-Of-Run event. This event is defined once but included in each of the related split files written out.
      Specified by:

    • getByteBuffer

      public ByteBuffer getByteBuffer()
      Get the byte buffer being read directly or corresponding to the event file. Not a very useful method. For files, it works only for evio format versions 2,3 and returns the internal buffer containing an evio block if using sequential access (for example files > 2.1 GB). It returns the memory mapped buffer otherwise. For reading buffers it returns the buffer being read.
      Specified by:
      getByteBuffer in interface IEvioReader
      Returns:
      the byte buffer being read (in certain cases).

    • fileSize

      public long fileSize()
      Get the size of the file being read, in bytes. For small files, obtain the file size using the memory mapped buffer's capacity.
      Specified by:
      fileSize in interface IEvioReader
      Returns:
      the file size in bytes

    • getEvent

      public EvioEvent getEvent(int index) throws EvioException
      Get the event in the file/buffer at a given index (starting at 1). As useful as this sounds, most applications will probably call parseNextEvent() or parseEvent(int) instead, since it combines getting an event with parsing it.

      Specified by:
      getEvent in interface IEvioReader
      Parameters:
      index - the event number in a 1,2,..N counting sense, from beginning of file/buffer.
      Returns:
      the event in the file/buffer at the given index or null if none
      Throws:
      EvioException - if failed read due to bad file/buffer format; if out of memory; if index out of bounds; if object closed

    • parseEvent

      public EvioEvent parseEvent(int index) throws EvioException
      This is a workhorse method. It retrieves the desired event from the file/buffer, and then parses it SAX-like. It will drill down and uncover all structures (banks, segments, and tagsegments) and notify any interested listeners.
      Specified by:
      parseEvent in interface IEvioReader
      Parameters:
      index - number of event desired, starting at 1, from beginning of file/buffer
      Returns:
      the parsed event at the given index or null if none
      Throws:
      EvioException - if failed read due to bad file/buffer format; if out of memory; if index out of bounds; if object closed

    • nextEvent

      public EvioEvent nextEvent() throws EvioException
      Get the next event in the file/buffer. As useful as this sounds, most applications will probably call IEvioReader.parseNextEvent() instead, since it combines getting the next event with parsing the next event.

      Although this method can get events in versions 4+, it now delegates that to another method. No changes were made to this method from versions 1-3 in order to read the version 4 format as it is subset of versions 1-3 with variable block length.

      Specified by:
      nextEvent in interface IEvioReader
      Returns:
      the next event in the file. On error it throws an EvioException. On end of file, it returns null.
      Throws:
      EvioException - if failed read due to bad buffer format; if object closed

    • parseNextEvent

      public EvioEvent parseNextEvent() throws IOException, EvioException
      This is a workhorse method. It retrieves the next event from the file/buffer, and then parses it SAX-like. It will drill down and uncover all structures (banks, segments, and tagsegments) and notify any interested listeners.
      Specified by:
      parseNextEvent in interface IEvioReader
      Returns:
      the event that was parsed. On error it throws an EvioException. On end of file, it returns null.
      Throws:
      IOException - if failed file access
      EvioException - if read failure or bad format if object closed

    • parseEvent

      public void parseEvent(EvioEvent evioEvent) throws EvioException
      This will parse an event, SAX-like. It will drill down and uncover all structures (banks, segments, and tagsegments) and notify any interested listeners.

      As useful as this sounds, most applications will probably call IEvioReader.parseNextEvent() instead, since it combines getting the next event with parsing the next event.

      This method is only called by synchronized methods and therefore is not synchronized.

      Specified by:
      parseEvent in interface IEvioReader
      Parameters:
      evioEvent - the event to parse.
      Throws:
      EvioException - if bad format

    • getEventArray

      public byte[] getEventArray(int eventNumber) throws EvioException
      Get an evio bank or event in byte array form.
      Specified by:
      getEventArray in interface IEvioReader
      Parameters:
      eventNumber - number of event of interest (starting at 1).
      Returns:
      array containing bank's/event's bytes.
      Throws:
      EvioException - if eventNumber out of bounds (starts at 1); if the event number does not correspond to an existing event; if object closed

    • getEventBuffer

      public ByteBuffer getEventBuffer(int eventNumber) throws EvioException, IOException
      Get an evio bank or event in ByteBuffer form.
      Specified by:
      getEventBuffer in interface IEvioReader
      Parameters:
      eventNumber - number of event of interest
      Returns:
      buffer containing bank's/event's bytes.
      Throws:
      EvioException - if eventNumber is out of bounds; if the event number does not correspond to an existing event; if object closed
      IOException - if failed file access

    • rewind

      public void rewind()
      The equivalent of rewinding the file. What it actually does is set the position of the sequential index back to the beginning. This allows a mix of sequential calls with those that are not sequential.
      Specified by:
      rewind in interface IEvioReader

    • position

      public long position()
      This method is not relevant in evio 6, does nothing, and returns 0.
      Specified by:
      position in interface IEvioReader
      Returns:
      the position of the buffer; -1 if version 4+

    • close

      public void close() throws IOException
      This is closes the file, but for buffers it only sets the position to 0.

      close in interface IEvioReader
      Throws:
      IOException - if error accessing file

    • getCurrentBlockHeader

      public IBlockHeader getCurrentBlockHeader()
      This returns the current (active) block (physical record) header. Since most users have no interest in physical records, this method should not be used.
      Specified by:
      getCurrentBlockHeader in interface IEvioReader
      Returns:
      the current block header.

    • getEventCount

      public int getEventCount() throws EvioException

    • getBlockCount

      Returns:
